means: [人名] [苏格兰人、北方英格兰人姓氏] 怀特绰号，意志坚强者或勇敢的人，来源于中世纪英语，含义是“勇敢的，刚强的”(valiant,stalwart)
[人名] [苏格兰人、北方英格兰人姓氏] 怀特地貌名称，河流或道路的弯曲处，来源于古英语

sentence.Network_en: After much cogitation, we decided to move to the Isle of Wight.
sentence.Network_cn: 经过慎重考虑后，我们决定搬到怀特岛去。

sentence.Network_en: She sought the advice of their old friend from Isle of Wight days , John Stebbings.
sentence.Network_cn: 她征求了在怀特岛时认识的老朋友约翰·斯特宾斯的意见.

sentence.Network_en: Thomas Arnold , English educationalist , was born on the Isle of Wight.
sentence.Network_cn: 英国教育家 托马斯·诺德 生于怀特岛.

derivation.yuyuan_name: Old English wiht 'thing, creature', of Germanic origin; related to Dutch wicht 'little child' and German Wicht 'creature'
